wastewater_rsv.long_name: Wastewater Viral Activity Level of RSV
wastewater_rsv.short_description: Wastewater Viral Activity Level of RSV.
wastewater_rsv.long_description: Wastewater Viral Activity Level (VAL) of RSV. The viral activity level is the scaled number of standard deviations above a dynamic baseline. The baseline is the 10th percentile of the log-transformed and normalized concentration values, which is calculated within a 18 month timeframe every year. This is then scaled, where e is the mathmatical constant, and x is the number of standard deviations: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">VAL = e^{x}</annotation></semantics></math> These values are categorized as very low, low, moderate, high, or very high using the following breakpoints: 4, 8, 12, and 20.
wastewater_rsv.statement: The viral activity level of RSV in wastewater is {value}.
wastewater_rsv.unit: linear scaling of log standard deviations above a baseline

sources.name: National Wastewater Surveillance System
sources.location: Wastewater RSV State and Territory Trends

wastewater_flua.long_name: Wastewater Viral Activity Level of Influenza A
wastewater_flua.short_description: Wastewater Viral Activity Level of Influenza A.
wastewater_flua.long_description: Wastewater Viral Activity Level (VAL) of Influenza A. The viral activity level is the scaled number of standard deviations above a dynamic baseline. The baseline is the 10th percentile of the log-transformed and normalized concentration values, which is calculated within a 18 month timeframe every year. This is then scaled, where e is the mathmatical constant, and x is the number of standard deviations: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">VAL = e^{x}</annotation></semantics></math> These values are categorized as very low, low, moderate, high, or very high using the following breakpoints: 1.6, 4.5, 12.2, and 20.1.
wastewater_flua.statement: The viral activity level of Influenza A in wastewater is {value}.
wastewater_flua.unit: linear scaling of log standard deviations above a baseline

sources.name: National Wastewater Surveillance System

wastewater_covid.long_name: Wastewater Viral Activity Level of COVID-19
wastewater_covid.short_description: Wastewater Viral Activity Level of COVID-19.
wastewater_covid.long_description: Wastewater Viral Activity Level (VAL) of COVID-19. The viral activity level is the scaled number of standard deviations above a dynamic baseline. The baseline is the 10th percentile of the log-transformed and normalized concentration values, which is calculated within a 12 month timeframe every 6 months. This is then scaled, where e is the mathmatical constant, and x is the number of standard deviations: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>e</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">VAL = e^{x}</annotation></semantics></math> These values are categorized as very low, low, moderate, high, or very high using the following breakpoints: 1.5, 3, 4.5, and 8.
wastewater_covid.statement: The viral activity level of COVID-19 in wastewater is {value}.
wastewater_covid.unit: linear scaling of log standard deviations above a baseline

sources.name: National Wastewater Surveillance System
sources.location: Wastewater COVID-19 State and Territory Trends
